vividhaiku: Why not go to Thailand? Amazing medical there. 10% the cost.
jessicahollyabdo: Thank you for sharing this! ❤️ When I had cancer it was a rare form of lymphoma that was in my skin cells. I had it for at least 4 years before it was diagnosed & during that time it would visibly diminish in times of lowered stress, then with increased stress it would grow & turn from light pink/red to dark purple & the pain would dramatically increase. I’ve seen the proof, cancer as well as other illnesses grow & feed off stress. This is crucial! And when dealing with chronic illness or any illness having an advocate is crucial. Many patients develop PTSD from traumatizing Dr. interactions as well as the billing side of things which can be a nightmare. Thank you for sharing this, it’s so important. Glad to hear you’re doing well. ☺️❤️
maggie_griffieth: I deal with this also after being in a car accident and having degenerative disc disease, doctors refused to treat me like I was in real pain because I’m so young but have a spitting clean health record prior to all of this. 2 years later fighting to be heard and literally crying in front of doctors I found one that takes me seriously and goes by the tests not his option!
karagibbybeauty: I have been suffering a mystery illness with extreme chronic pain for 7 years. If my doctors can't or won't help, who will? @ihartericka

ksthornty: This is powerful. In the U.K. now we’re facing an ever increasing private healthcare system as politicians push to privatise the NHS in an attempt to solve our national debt. gurue: Amen!!!! Well said! I express this daily
anja5213: My house burned down and Aetna refused to provide me with thyroid disease medication saying, you just filled it. What do you not understand about my state is burning and my house is gone? missmichellemaster: YESSSS. Thank you for this. So well put, people need to know about this. I often say the stress of juggling “the system” and medical bills, etc would kill me far before the cancer. It is something that people just don’t understand, thank you for sharing🙌🏻❤️
wickedwitcharika: I had a disassotive mental break due to a very traumatic event combined with my son being diagnosed with autism and a serious growth delay.I was prescribed a cocktail of anti depressants, anti anxiety, and sleeping pills. I told the psychiatrist I didn't want pills( mind you I had a 3 week old baby) I needed help and talk out my problems. I was then offered 1 week of group life skills therapy! Really I said...the dr apologized and said the mental health system is overwhelmed and they can't just talk out everyone's problems there is not enough time, and therapists. I said wow...but if I go home and kill my children and myself then I'll get help in prison💁🏾 she just gave me a blank look. I left there and went into a deep depression that had me unable to function for 2 yrs. then I decided I wanted different and starting running(not saying that's a cure ) but for me while I was running I got all that junk off my soul. I went back to work, and I'm slowly putting my life back together. I was very close to just throwing in the towel on life and then it clicked. If I can be so very low on one side of the spectrum of life, than I also could be equally high on the other end of the spectrum . The mental health care system is a joke in this country ! Just like the health care system. Ppl need real ppl to talk to not pills to numb everything and ppl need real food to heal their bodies ! Our system is one of disease management and trying to wind ppl back up after they've come apart.
